revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=EA6300 |revision=v0.1 (R01/0A1) |upc=745883597420 |ean= |asin=B00C0WZ9FW |price= |est_release_date=04/30/2013 |fcc_date=12/28/2012 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Arcadyan |manuf_model=WG9116F |manuf_rev=AC22-88 |availability=now |type=wireless router |fcc_id=Q87-EA6300 |ic_id=3839A-EA6300 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM47081A0;BCM47081A0KFEBG; |cpu1_cspeed=800 |cpu1_cores=1 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model=NAND |fla2=4 |fla2_brand= |fla2_model=SPI |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM68C16CWQD-25H |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag=yes,, 14-pad header,, |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4352;BCM4352KMLG; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43217;BCM43217TKMLG; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=C0:C1:C0 |oui_eth=C0:C1:C0 }} {{TagLine|AC1200 Dual Band Wi-Fi Router}} :[https://www.linksys.com/gb/p/P-EA6300/ Product page]
"P/N:141â€¦" and "REV:0A1" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The ''[[Arcadyan]]'' project listed on the FCC label is WG9116FAC22-88 (10/24/2012) :The serial number on the FCC label is '''01C10C1C007544''' :The MAC on the FCC label is '''C0C1C03C5F73''' ([http://hwaddress.com/?q=C0:C1:C0 Cisco-Linksys, LLC]) It would seem the default SSID pattern for this device will be '''LinksysXXXXX'''
This device seems to use a ''[[Broadcom]]'' BCM47081A0KFEBG processor. :This device obviously includes a GbE Switch (+ PHYs) and, [http://www.anandtech.com/show/5925/broadcom-announces-bcm4708x-and-bcm5301x-socs-for-80211ac-routers per AnandTech], :possesses two ARM Cortex A9 cores and includes USB 3.0 support.
There appears to be a small Serial Flash on the top of the board :and a larger NAND Flash on the bottom.
{{WiFiCert|WFA18036|01/22/2013}}
===News=== *[http://home.cisco.com/en-us/press/releases/release_linksys_01072013 ''Announced in this press release''] (01/07/2013) :[http://www.engadget.com/2013/01/07/linksys-reveals-a-trio-of-802-11ac-wifi-routers-with-beamforming/ PR via '''Engadget'''] *[http://ces.cnet.com/8301-34439_1-57562440/cisco-adds-three-more-routers-to-its-802.11ac-portfolio/ ''Cisco adds three more routers to its 802.11ac portfolio'' on '''C|NET'''] :One USB 3.0 port *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-features/32089-a-nice-surprise-for-early-linksys-ea6300-buyers ''A Nice Surprise For Early Linksys EA6300 Buyers'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :It appears early EA6300 units (EA6300V1) are actually [[Linksys EA6400]]
